metadata.title: CVE-2018-25103 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
There exists use-after-free vulnerabilities in lighttpd <= 1.4.50 requestparsing which might read from invalid pointers to memory used in the samerequest, not from other requests.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-25103` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lighttpd - 1.4.55-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-authn-gssapi - 1.4.55-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-authn-pam - 1.4.55-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-authn-sasl - 1.4.55-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-cml - 1.4.55-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-geoip - 1.4.55-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-magnet - 1.4.55-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-maxminddb - 1.4.55-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-trigger-b4-dl - 1.4.55-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-vhostdb-dbi - 1.4.55-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-vhostdb-pgsql - 1.4.55-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-webdav - 1.4.55-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-modules-ldap - 1.4.55-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-modules-mysql - 1.4.55-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lighttpd package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.55-1ubuntu1').
